metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9157 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Format string vulnerability in the yyerror function in lib/cgraph/scan.l inGraphviz allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via formatstring specifiers in unknown vectors, which are not properly handled in anerror string.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9157` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphviz - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libcdt5 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libcgraph6 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgv-guile - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgv-lua - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgv-perl - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgv-php5 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgv-python - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgv-ruby - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgv-tcl - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgvc6 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgvc6-plugins-gtk - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libgvpr2 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libpathplan4 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
libxdot4 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphviz package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.0-0ubuntu3.1').
